review_title: Guthrie is a great place to work

review_title: Really ask the right questions when you are interviewing; get ALL the facts regarding the positon and what to expect.
job_title: Quality Improvement Specialist in Sayre, PA
pros: Very good benefits. Colleagues are very kind and welcoming, and there is a lot to learn on the job. If you are there long enough you can really gain a strong understanding of what works and does not work in a health care system in regards to quality.
cons:
This is long, but let me try to help you understand what you are in for if you are strongly considering this job.

First off, I invested A LOT in this job. Including moving to a completely different location, buying a car, paying travel expenses, among other things. It was a career-changing position I accepted, I assumed it would be treated as such while I worked there. 

Anyway, going into the role itself:

There is NO work-to-life balance. As my boss put it, you have to kick off the ground running. Pretty much since the first day I started working I could tell that this job was more than I was expecting. 

When I first applied to this role, I assumed (based on the job description) that they just wanted someone who has had experience working on projects, and can communicate with other departments, and basically work together as a team to solve company issues, and present the findings to the higher-ups. That was just the surface, there is a lot more in the job description than they tell you, ask for full details on what you will be doing (it is about a page or 2).

Here is a list of a few things I was not aware of but did what I could to make work: There is a lot of secretarial work that is involved with the job, such as being a fast typer in meetings and marking down all the data in a very short amount of time; filling out patient safety injuries (such as falls) prior to the start of the workday, an hour to 2 hours prior (8 AM-5 PM is the workday, the actual time is 6:30 AM-6:30 PM, on a good day, or 5 AM - 10 PM on a bad day, all exempt). Developing hospital quality committees, which I think was a great way to learn a lot about how hospitals function, but something you should develop an understanding of after solid exposure to how a new entity works, something you do a few months into a new job, not a few weeks in. There were other responsibilities I was not aware of, but was, of course, willing to learn how to do, but was never given a real chance or any guidance on how to go about them, just thrown into with the hopes of making a basket. 

I also, unfortunately, started in the busiest month of the year (because it was the start of the new fiscal year). So it was incredibly difficult to reach out to my supervisor, or other colleagues for help on how to do assignments because they were so frantic and busy. This caused delays in my work, uncertainty as to whether or not I was getting things done the right way, miscommunication with my supervisor (who was incredibly overwhelmed and overworked), which lead to hesitancy on whether to ask any questions at all for clarity because I did not want to frustrate her any further. This, among other things, made it a very tough environment to work in. 

This eventually led to my termination shortly after starting (about a month), which was stunning, especially after the amount I invested in to move there. This was a termination I think could have been avoided entirely if there was structured guidance by my superior, proper shadowing on how to do my job (which I was told I would get but never received when I started working there). Starting in a time that was less busy and frantic (which was not my fault), and an understanding that it takes time to fully understand how an entire hospital entity operates when you are new somewhere. Which includes knowing the number of quality committees there are, and thoroughly understanding what they all do; the QAPI policy (which is needed in QI of course, but something that takes time to fully understand, and I never really got), leapfrog (again common, but something that takes time to know.), and finally PI projects (which I was never given a chance to work on, on account of all the other stuff, which is very disappointing).

pros: .good coworkers who have each others back
cons: .management didn't care about employees

review_title: Great place to work if you prefer a very rural setting
pros: The pay is quite well for the area as well as numerous opportunities for progression through the company. Everyone in my department is very talented, ambitious, and amazing to work with. The company has visions of what they would like to do to continue to provide quality care and remain competitive which provides a strong outlook for the future of the company. Sayre is within an hour of four larger towns (Ithaca, Binghamton, Corning, Elmira) which provides more entertainment and recreational activities. The health coverage is also extremely generous compared to other systems.
cons: Having to use PTO for standard holidays is something that could be improved. Additionally I really wish Guthrie would invest in building out the town and making it a more inviting place for people to live as opposed to trying to use Ithaca & Corning as a place for employees to live which then requires them to drive 45 mins+ and shuttle in to work due to lack of parking.

pros: Now 2019, I have worked at Guthrie right out of college in 1987, or almost 32 years now.  Guthrie has proven to be a great partnership to me, affording me many opportunities to grow personally and professionally, while providing support and flexibility over the years with work-life balance.  My salary has steadily climbed as well and we have very solid benefits.   I have a wonderful opportunity in my role to interact with fellow employees and help support them in my training classes.   I am given the opportunity to use my creative side in my work with developing job aids and training programs that use the skills and talents that I have.  I have a new manager, who is an amazing blessing and asset to Guthrie...and we have only seen a fraction of what he is capable of.
cons: Personally, I don't have a single "con" to mention.  I am blessed beyond belief in my department and in my role.

review_title: Guthrie has the right tools to make a difference
pros: Leadership at Guthrie understands that to succeed, teams and leaders need a vision and the tools to make a difference. My manager is very supportive and my team is very talented. We work well together and understand our goals. We are focused on doing the right things for patients and we use data to validate the decisions of how and what needs to be done.
cons: The number of employees over many sites/wide geography can make it challenging to get everyone on the same page. Some business goals may seem to compete because healthcare industry is complex with multiple payor models. Guthrie is working hard to make sure they stay on the forefront of business systems and approaches to health. This isn’t always embraced by employees who have being doing something the same way for years.

review_title: It really doesn't get better than this!
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Troy, PA
pros: I love the environment here in the clinic. It's the perfect pace for this point in my career. I've been a nurse for 16 years, and have held various positions at other facilities from floor nursing in Oncology/Nephrology/Urology to L&D as well as a Nurse Manager position. The providers, nurses and PSS staff are wonderful to work with. Most importantly, I truly enjoy the patients! It is a wonderful feeling to be genuinely helping people on a daily basis, getting to know them and even their families is quite an enjoyable component of clinic setting nursing. I am enjoying everything about the clinic: the hours are great for a FT working mother with young children at home, the PTO accrual is phenomenal which allows me to not miss their school activities, and this is a beautiful facility to work in. I am loving my time at Guthrie.
cons: Nothing. I certainly made the right decision in my career by joining Guthrie! I have absolutely no regrets.

pros: I worked previously at another healthcare system closer to home so I was hesitant to commit to a 40 minute commute but Guthrie has been a wonderful place to work. I feel support from co-workers, colleagues and senior leadership.  Our department feels like a second family. The expectations are high and the work is challenging (after all, this is healthcare!) but I am part of a great team that works hard, is highly accountable but likes to have fun in the process. People seem to advance or move on to new opportunities at Guthrie, which demonstrates that leadership recognizes talent. We are one of the few health systems in the region not affiliated or owned by a larger entity, which is refreshing. Health benefits are excellent. I love it here!
cons: Certain business practices  can be a bit behind the times and it would be nice not to have to use PTO for holidays.  Rural location can make it hard to attract talent.

job_title: Patient Service Specialist in Sayre, PA

cons:

High turnover in nearly every department
Favoritism to certain departments/providers/employees
Questionable and unethical HR/management practices

pros: I’ve been working at Guthrie for over a decade.  I feel Guthrie is the health care leader in the region and it gives me a sense of pride to work for a place that puts the patient first.  Although I am not in a position of direct patient care, I do feel everyone strives to make what they do be a difference to each patient.
cons: The workload and expectations in my department are at a very high level, and can be overwhelming at times, but I wouldn’t want it any other way, as I feel we need to perform at our best.  That being said, I do feel adding additional staff would be a plus.

review_title: A great community resource and a great place to work
pros: Guthrie is authentic in its commitment to its patients, staff, and community. The company is building a culture where all are encouraged to bubble up feedback and suggestions to improve the way we do business. Opportunity to grow within the organization is there if you work for it. The salary is competitive, and the benefits are fair. I have had the opportunity to work in various departments and can honestly say that the teams I have been part of here have made me feel more connected to the organization than any other place I have worked.
cons: Parking in Sayre is terrible. The organization has difficulty attracting talent to fill critical gaps from outside of the area...likely the area not the company.

review_title: Decent place to start but wouldn't want to stay long term
pros:
+ Starting pay is competitive
+ Good benefits
+ Opportunity to work with some really great people
+ Good reputation for patient care
+ Resume builder
cons:
- Many departments are chronically overworked and understaffed (conditions that can and do breed tyrannical supervisors)
- Salary increases flatline for long term employees
- Growing sense of underlying discontent among employees who feel they are working harder for less
- Little opportunity for career advancement/skill diversification depending on what you do
- Limited parking around hospital campus and shuttle to far parking lot adds an extra 10-15 mins. to commute time

pros: I like some of my coworkers.
cons: Management is horrible. They are constantly  adding more and more steps to an already hard job. Things are all ways changing and not for the better. With no bonus, extra pay or even a pat on the back. Executives who never have been in the trenches make all the discussions without even have done the job. Guthrie has gone down hill so fast. Employees are leaving left and rigght. It's so bad even travel nurses quit. They treat there employees like cattle. They never listen or try to help. They say if you don't like it leave.

review_title: Great place to work, beautiful area, wonderful coworkers. Facility really cares about its employees.
pros: I have worked for Guthrie  for 5 years plus 2 years when I was in high school.  This is a GREAT company to work for.  They really care about their employees. Its nice to walk down the hall and have upper management stop and talk to you like an old friend.  The pay is pretty competitive. The work environment is  clean.  Its honestly a great place to work. My mother retired from here.  Im always telling people to come here and work.
cons: The vacation package and PTO could be a lot better! BUT that is really the only thing I can complain about.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Corning, NY
pros: Hmm not many positive things I can say. Was not a good experience.
cons:
- staff are rude and unwelcoming to new staff, felt like an intruder.
- too many cliques
- clinics are not clean, and many times are in violation of DOL & DOH standards
- not very organized about workflow- expect staff to manage work, without giving the proper slotted time to complete task. 
- refuse to pay any overtime- will be expected to "donate" your time to complete tasks

pros: Guthrie provides me a work experience that is fulfilling and appreciated. I enjoy my work and the people I work with.  I rarely traveled to Sayre before working here and wasn't crazy about driving 30 minutes to work each day but now that I have been doing it for several years, I really don't mind the drive as it gives me time to unwind and think about what I need to accomplish each day.  Medical benefits are top of the line.
cons: Probably the only inconvenience is that you have to park across town and take a shuttle. The shuttle service is quite reliable and you do get used to this but it would be nice to have access to your vehicle during the work day.

pros: Health insurance  and prescription coverage is good.
cons: You are not a person, you are just a cog in the Guthrie machine.  It doesn’t matter to administration if you do your job and do it well, if they want you out you will be out because sitting in their offices and having meetings with each other, about nothing, they know exactly how to do your job. They have the mentality of, if it looks good on paper then it will work and it doesn’t matter how it affects anyone.

review_title: A great place to work in our region ... The Guthrie Clinic
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Sayre, PA
pros: Wide variety of opportunities available.  Employees are able to create their own career path by taking advantage of tuition reimbursement and training and development programs.  Many different career avenues to select from - both clinical and non-clinical.  Employees at Guthrie really care about the patient and the patient (and family member's) experience.  It's a great place to work in our region and THE place to receive care.
cons: Like most places, the team at Guthrie can and should continue to improve the way they communicate across and throughout the organization.  Ensure that all key messages are heard and understood.

pros: During the current merge there has been lots of questions, concerns, and just nervous chatter but the head of HR has been open and honest about everthing she can tell us and she is frequently walking around each floor to talk to employees and answer all the questions she can. Also I love the  staff I work with and management provides an over all great environment.
cons: Sometimes scheduling can get a little confusing. Cortland isn't the nicest town so there is sometimes challenging patients, but it keeps us on our toes and no day is ever the same.

review_title: You're Better Off Finding A Job In Fast Food
pros: Large company allows plenty of opportunity for transfer, best health care provider in the area, turnover & growth in health care sector means that they're usually hiring
cons: Poor pay, low recognition, lots of in-fighting/drama among staff, abuse from both clients AND management is the norm... Expect to try and make your own happiness here, as you aren't likely to find much enjoyment or fulfillment from getting abused by "clients"/your managers, trying to avoid the gossip mill & who is having an affair with who or which staff are stealing/addicted to narcotics, or your pay- which, for a certified phlebotomist in NY is literally less than what you can make working at Taco Bell.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Corning, NY
pros: I have been with Guthrie for a little over 2 years now. I love working with our patients and my fellow co-workers. I have had jobs in the past that I have really enjoyed working at, but I really truly love working here as we are a family at Guthrie. I have set goals for myself and achieved them with the help of my team and leaders.
cons: I can not say that I have anything bad to say about my employment with Guthrie. I feel that there are good and bad at any place you work, you just need to not dwell on the bad and learn from it to make it a positive.

pros: Taking care of patients doing my job do help them
cons: Very very very understaffed management does not thank you for your hard work the new test you must take to get a job if you fail you do not get the job must wait one year to reapply if already employed if you fail won't get it I understand from in house it's not to be a pass or fail I figure if I need take test for job then my skills mean nothing to that hospital it's a down grade of my nursing career manager doesn't listen at all they worry about themselves nothing for patients and staff

pros: Benefits are okay. People here are, for the mist part, freindly.
cons: No advancement. Jobs applied to seem to go to outside people. Pay raises are insignificant compared to insurance increases and pay scale is reviewed infrequently. In 5 years, my rate of pay increased less than $2 total.

review_title: Honored To Work At The Guthrie Clinic
pros: It is truly and honor to come into an organization that is staffed with dedicated people from the immediate community and beyond, all working together to make true community healthcare a reality.
cons: The incessant need to chase revenue many times translates into decisions being based on short sighted gains instead of long lasting efficiency and sustainable growth.

review_title: A well rounded place to work!
pros: Guthrie provides a work/family balance. They take into consideration the need to grow as an employee and a member of the community. They allow for career advancement with training and support. Administration takes the thoughts and ideas of all members of the team into consideration when making decisions. Guthrie is a team working to uphold the culture and values it stands for.
cons: Guthrie is a large organization covering 5 hospitals and 40+ clinics in a large geographic area. This can make it difficult to feel knowledgeable about the organization as a whole and included in the big picture.

review_title: Standard Operating Procedure - depends on where you work and who your boss is
pros: Great health benefits and great pay for the work I didn't have to do.
cons: long drive, poor management in my immediate area, lack of physical work and to much down time in my position.

pros: Guthrie improves lives, and it is very gratifying to contribute to that. The people here are dedicated to that mission and to each other.
cons: The workload can be overwhelming at times, and employees who perform well are "rewarded" with more work. The constant push for growth does not give us time to appreciate our successes.

pros: Guthrie is patient centered,has great core values ,enjoy working as a team . Monday - Friday 8-5  only work 5 days on weekend a year, Benefits are great ,they work with you to balance your work/family
cons:
having to work short staffed when call ins as not enough float staff to cover all areas.  
Pay rate

review_title: Supportive leadership provides resources and encouragement
pros: Data-driven decisions; collaboration among and across teams; fair compensation; staff is valued; clear vision for the organization so we are poised to succeed at the mission; opportunities for advancement for those who are invested in the organization.
cons: Work is demanding, as in all health care jobs.

pros: Great environment ,love the patients. Willingness to work with your schedule.
cons: Pay is low. Management is not working together. Too many people play the authoritative role when not in their scope of practice. A lot of favouritism . We shouldnt have to use our pto for sickness etc. Especially for holiday pay. Holiday pay is the reason a lot of people work and miss time with their families we should be compensated like amy other job and not pay ourselves out of our pto!

review_title: Don't work there unless you are related!!
pros: Wow! None! I would say patients first but that turned out to be a lie!
cons: Where do I start? There is a network of ”family first” if you are not related you are done and they black all you!! No support. Poor management. Smile to your face and cut you off at the knees. You will never see it coming!!

pros: My interview process with smooth and simple and the recruiter kept in contact with me throughout.  The on-boarding / pre-employment items were simple. There is opportunity to advance/move within the company and as well as a lot of people with long tenure, which says a lot to me. Senior management is approachable and knows where they are leading the company. Guthrie offers great benefits and a work/life balance.
cons: So far everything is great here

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Sayre, PA
pros: Guthrie has also done an amazing job at providing me with a great work/life balance. I have always felt like an important part of the team I am working with, and my co-workers are some of the best people I've ever met. I started my career here, and I plan on finishing my career here. I can't think of a better place to work.
cons: There isn't a negative thing I could say about Guthrie.

job_title: Manager Employee Health in Sayre, PA
pros: Excellent opportunity for learning and professional growth.   Supportive leadership teams that work together to complete organizational goals.  Assist in setting professional goals and identifying the path for successful completion.
cons: One con, would be the challenges involving leadership and management.  However,  breaking the barriers and achieving professional goals makes these challenges rewarding.

review_title: A company that values strong teamwork and collaboration
pros: Opportunities to become a valued team member with a voice that makes a difference at any level in the organization. Strong teamwork approach and collaboration crossing throughout all the departments. There is a strong emphasis on growing as an individual and within the organization. All departments focusing on one goal - patient outcomes.
cons: At this time I do not have any cons.

review_title: Horrible. Bad. Waste of time. ... At least if you aren't doing your boss.
pros: Not a singular one to speak of
cons: Management treats you like crap, and unless you are related to someone there do not expect to be treated fairly. Unreal expectations from out of touch management. Corners are cut at anyones expence except yours. Dig in their dumpster... i gaurantee you will find ketamine and propofol... just be careful not to intract with any radioactive items.

review_title: Career changing employment with growth opportunity
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Sayre, PA
pros: Fast paced environment, clear outline of duties, excellent health benefits and retirement, current technology, growth opportunity, tuition reimbursement available if furthering education, wide range of specialties to move into, only requires 1 year before changing into another department, wide service range
cons: Wages are not competitive, hard to secure interview, long on-boarding process, upper management very separated from staff, no company cars available for travel to outlying clinics

review_title: Feeling pretty good for the long haul
pros: I see potential for growth here. I'm able to share my thoughts. I've been able to pick up on things quickly due in part to my peers.
cons: communication and negative attitudes.

review_title: It is a very conducive environment to work,  well behaved staff and management
job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Sayre, PA
pros: The management has the interest of employees at heart and they take very good care of them
cons: I dont think I have seen any challenge yet

pros: Management does a good job of listening to employee concerns and provide a variety of ways for employees to provide feedback/opinions. The pay, benefits, PTO are all reasonable. They treat their employees well.
cons: There is never a shortage of work to be done (not a con if you like to stay busy). The parking on Sayre campus and taking a shuttle bus can be frustrating.

review_title: Great place, not a lot of opportunity for growth
job_title: Doctor of Physical Therapy in Corning, NY
pros: Senior management listens to patient needs,  good benefits and health care. Good communication with referring MD
cons: Low salary for job title when compared to elsewhere in state.  Low to normal when compared to local salary. Very busy schedule. However admin staff allows time for documentation!

review_title: Job was completely different than advertised
pros: Salary was decent, largest healthcare system in the area, nice surrounding suburb that looked safe to live in, nice looking campus.
cons: Job was completely different than advertised. Almost nothing on the job posting coincided with the actual responsibilities. This shows the company stretches the truth, and I am not interest in working for a company I cannot trust.

pros: Insurance, Work environment, friendly, Pay
cons: Management, Supervisors, Lack of job role education, employee parking, local government regarding Guthrie employees

pros: No Pros to list here.
cons: I had travelled over 200 miles at least 5 times to and from Guthrie hospital for interview, then physical and drug screen just to be informed the week I was to start working that my employment was being put on hold because I did not have the National Phlebotomist certification. The worst part is that Guthrie interviewer knew I did not have the certificate but that I have the Diploma for having gone through the training yet, she offered me the job, gave me a start date and pay rate then set me up for a physical and drug screen which I had to do a different day. Also requested that I submit my Diploma and vaccination record. I travelled over 5 hours to do this physical and drug screen after working a full week, took a day off work at my current job in Pittsburgh, PA and had to return in Pittsburgh, PA exhausted. I then called to get a fax number to send the vaccination record just to be told that my employment was being put in hold since I didn't have the National Phlebotomist certification. Really not nice that Guthrie did this, first, they were offering me less pay than what I am worth which I reluctantly accepted because I was planning to move to the area and needed a job till I find a better one. Second, Guthrie HR are not nice for how they handled my hiring process. They made me loose income travelling back and forth between Pittsburgh PA and Sayre PA several times, doing physicials, drug screen, etc just to be told the week I am to start that they were not going to let me start working and that they were going to send me a different lower offer as if the initial offer was not low enough already. This is not how to treat people, Guthrie hospital. I AM LETTING EVERYONE KNOW, DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME APPLYING TO GUTHRIE HOSPITAL. They will just screw you up, not apologize, not compensate for their mistakes and you will be the one suffering. After this horrendous experience, I will not work for GUTHRIE HOSPITAL even at a lower lower pay rate or a higher rate as they have shown themselves to be not nice people who don't care and are heartless.

review_title: Enjoy working at Robert Packer Hospital
pros: Management keeps you involved in decision making.  Pay is commensurate with other similar businesses, benefits are great.  Good environment to work.
cons: Can't think of any cons other than, when working at a hospital, patients are sick and sometimes pass.  Very sad.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Troy, PA
pros: Love working for Guthrie. Health benefits are the best out there for an amazing price as well
cons: For the most part I can't think of anything bad. Some think that the pay scale should be more. Not working weekends or holidays for me though is something I will take over extra money per hour

pros: The resident to aide ratio is usually pretty manageable
cons: They take forever to hire somebody me one, they favor day shift and make sure they get all the staff the need while 2nd and 3 rd have to manage running short 80% of the time.

job_title: Director, Practice Administration in Corning, NY
pros: Guthrie has an inclusive culture and supportive work environment. Very patient centered and promotes high quality care and services. Leadership is very supportive and invested in every employees success. This was a great career move and definitely met my expectations.
cons: None apply at this time.

review_title: Very committed talented staff, leadership very old fashioned.  More transactional than transformational leadership
pros: Competitive salaries, surprisingly up to date considering the rural location.
cons: Leadership more transactional than transformational.  Needs fresh leadership.  Physician/nurse relationships could be stronger

job_title: Care Coordinator/Registered Nurse in Wellsville, NY
pros: Excellent people to work with. Professional and open to new ideas. The case management team works closely with each other for the advancement of the department.
cons: The organization seems top-heavy with administrators who seem to mainly be concerned with revenue and not often concerned with employee satisfaction.

review_title: Great Place to work with plenty of opportunity.
pros: Both co-workers and management are highly skilled, professional, and fun. Decent pay, good medical, and relaxed atmosphere.
cons: There is no on site parking. You have to park in an off site location and shuttle in/out. There are no vision benefits.

job_title: Resident, General Surgery in Sayre, PA
pros: Great place to learn how to become a better clinician. They like to accept their own trainees for employment.
cons: understaffed, support staff not respected

job_title: Patient Service Representative in New York, NY
pros: Guthrie is always striving to put patient care first. It's a great pleasure being able to be part of company that takes care of their patients as well as their employees.
cons: There are none for this location

review_title: Wonderful place to work. Friendly work environment
pros: Local people taking care of the community. Trauma hospital in a small rural area. Amazing ED staff. Nursing Unit is excellent. Very knowledgeable health care providers.
cons: None, this is the best hospital, hands down.

pros: Nurses are great, security takes care of you. I have learned and grown a lot
cons: Can get hectic (but that is part of being on a psych floor or any medical floor)

pros: Steady work, decent pay, chances for moving up
cons: Can be political at times

pros: managers can be understanding and help when needing coverage
cons: staff is unprofessional, rude to patients, and really not meant to work in health care

pros: Welcoming company with people who want to see you succeed.
cons: There are minimal positions for Athletic Trainers outside of the high school setting.

pros: health insurance, good environment to work as a nurse (new facility)
cons: on-call sometimes, even though you  want to have more schedule, they don't give you schedule because of overtime pay.

pros: No pros to mention for this place
cons: Racism rampant within a lot of staff, supervisors,  and nursing managers. Very low hourly pay rates. Staff not inviting to other cultures, all ignorant and are backers but pretend to your face to be friends

pros: Can have it all at Guthrie.
cons: None at this point in time.

review_title: Siloed organization with very few looking at the big picture
pros: Salary is fairly high for the region.
cons: The management structure is very siloed and each EVP looks out for their own. It can be difficult to transfer from clinic to hospital because you get blocked by management.  Micromanagement is prevalent from the top down.

pros: Patient centeredness, every patient every time, strong teams
cons: no real cons legit employer

job_title: Manager, IT Business Operations in Sayre, PA
pros: Professionalism, customer oriented and friendly
cons: The location is great since it's a small neighborhood

pros: Amazing coworkers, meaningful work, good work
cons: Stressful, lack of management, under payed to the max

pros: Great teaching hospital- Wonderful nurses to work with. Always helpful staff. Internal drama as with every workplace....
cons: We were understaffed many times.

pros: I love the team I work with. They are supportive and make coming to work enjoyable.
cons: Parking at the Sayre Campus.

job_title: Unit Clerk/Care Partner in Sayre, PA
pros: Money was good , nurse help too.
cons: Not the right training , put on the floor at night with no training

pros: close to home, good healthcare
cons: ineffective management team, short staffed

job_title: Director of Operations in Cortland, NY
pros:
Professional development
Culture of kindness
Growth minded with insight and purpose
cons:
None... yet
Affiliations are a bit apart to foster cohesiveness with ease

review_title: Good employer similar issues that you find most places.
job_title: Per Diem RN in Sayre, PA
pros: Teamwork. Complex and variety of patients
cons: Stressful at times. High turn over rate.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Cardiology in Sayre, PA
pros: Great people, great system.
cons: I think it says something that I can't find a CON to write about.

review_title: big hospital in a small town
pros: Nice coworkers we had good teamwork
cons: staff have to take the shuttle to work

pros:
Great coworkers
Caring manager
Diligent and outstanding pediatricians and NP's
cons: Very busy with limited downtime

pros: Great location, good hours to work,
cons: Low pay, no opportunity grow and make more,

pros: It is very organized with good values.

pros: good people, good food in cafeteria

job_title: Critical Care Technician in Corning, NY

review_title: Great opportunity if you like country
pros: I have enjoyed the 2 years I have worked here.  I was looking to retire.
cons: float staff  experienced RN

pros: the hours and co workers

pros: Health insurance coverage is outstanding
